intro: Calycothrix breviseta, commonly known as the short-hairy calycothrix, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded woodland areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
